description: 8 Base Persona Templates for FMCG Product Launch Simulation - Women's Protein Drink (India Market)
generationMethod: Each base template is replicated ~62 times with small random variations in age and trait values

basePersonas.name: Urban Health Enthusiast
basePersonas.description: Highly health-conscious urban women with high disposable income. Very focused on quality and wellness. Less price-sensitive, values premium products.
keyBehaviors: Actively seeks sugar-free and organic options
Willing to pay premium for quality
Influenced by health benefits over price
Prefers brands with strong health credentials

basePersonas.name: Working Professional
basePersonas.description: Largest segment. Busy working women balancing career and health. Moderately price-conscious. Seeks convenience and value.

basePersonas.name: Budget-Conscious Mother
basePersonas.description: Mothers from Tier-2 cities managing family health on a budget. Highly price-sensitive but concerned about family nutrition.

basePersonas.name: Fitness-Focused Millennial
basePersonas.description: Gym-going, fitness-obsessed young women. Extremely health-conscious. Price is secondary to quality and results.
keyBehaviors: Willing to invest in premium fitness products
Active on social media for health tips

basePersonas.name: Traditional Homemaker
basePersonas.description: Traditional women from smaller cities. Very price-sensitive. Prefers familiar, trusted brands. Slower to adopt new products.

basePersonas.name: Young Student
basePersonas.description: College students and young adults with limited budget. Extremely price-sensitive. Low health consciousness but open to trendy products.
keyBehaviors: Will switch brands for better deals

basePersonas.name: Senior Citizen
basePersonas.description: Older women focused on health maintenance. Health-conscious but also price-aware. Extremely loyal to trusted brands.

basePersonas.name: Corporate Executive
basePersonas.description: High-earning corporate leaders. Values premium positioning and quality. Time-poor, seeks convenience.
keyBehaviors: Willing to pay for premium products

healthConsciousness.definition: How much the persona prioritizes health and wellness in purchasing decisions

priceSensitivity.definition: How sensitive the persona is to price changes (10 = extremely price-sensitive)

brandLoyalty.definition: How likely the persona is to stick with known brands vs trying new ones (10 = extremely loyal)

marketWeight.definition: Proportion of the target market this persona represents
